newsitem.title: UK: European cotton markets slow, litle changed.
newsitem.headline: European cotton markets slow, litle changed.

text.p: Most European raw cotton markets were in quiet mood and despite a modest increase in New York futures on Thursday, no noteworthy movement in the level of most trade offering rates was discernible, dealers said.
Mill buyers, for their part, adhered to the same selective buying policy in evidence for some time.

The pattern of trading remained basically unchanged with the sporadic enquiry in evidence leading to occasional business in the popular upland styles, including most notably West African and Central Asian.
